com.ibm.aglets.thread
Class AgletThreadPool

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.aglets.thread.AgletThreadPool

public class AgletThreadPool
extends java.lang.Object

A thread pool that provides pooling base mechanism for aglet threads. The idea behind this pool is quite simple: once a new thread is required the pool must be able to provide it. Provide a thread means either: a) provide an already created and idle thread; b) create a new thread if no one idle thread is available. Once a thread has finished its work it must be inserted again in the pool, thus it can be used in further thread needed conditions.

Author:
Luca Ferrari - cat4hire@users.sourceforge.net

Field Detail

logger

private AgletsLogger logger

minPoolSize

private int minPoolSize
The minimum size of the pool, that is the minimum number thread this pool must create on startup.

maxPoolSize

private int maxPoolSize
The max size of the pool, that is the max number of thread this pool can contain. After such number has been reached, the pool must suspend each request of a new thread until one becomes idle (and thus available) again.

mySelf

private static AgletThreadPool mySelf
A self reference to this object. This class is supposed to be a singleton, thus only one pool can exists in the whole system.

threads

private java.util.Stack<AgletThread> threads
The pool will keep the threads into a stack container.

threadGroup

private java.lang.ThreadGroup threadGroup
A thread group that contains all the threads this pool will create.

deliveryMessageThreads

private java.util.Stack<DeliveryMessageThread> deliveryMessageThreads
A stack for a specific type of threads: the delivery message threads.

createdThread

private int createdThread
A counter that indicates how many threads this pool has created until now. It is useful for checking that the pool has not gone over the maxPoolSize value.

busyThreads

private int busyThreads
A counter that provides an information about the number of busy threads in the pool.

Constructor Detail

AgletThreadPool

private AgletThreadPool()
Initializes the structures of the pool and creates the first threads (the minimum available threads) that will be used.

Method Detail

createNewThread

protected void createNewThread()
An utility method that creates a new thread, sets the group of the thread and pushes it into the stack, thus the new thread is available to the pool. Moreover, this method increases the createdThread value, thus to store the number of threads created by this pool.

getInstance

public static AgletThreadPool getInstance()
Creates a new instance of the pool and returns it to the caller.

Returns:
the instance of the thread pool for the running platform.

pop

public AgletThread pop(MessageManager messageManager)
                throws AgletException
Provides a new AgletThread to the caller. The AgletThread will be used combined with the specified message manager (that must be not-null). This method checks the pool to see if a good thread is contained in it, and thus such thread is returned. Otherwise, if possible (i.e., the pool has not yet reached the max size) a new thread is created. In the case there are no available threads and no more thread can be created (due to the reach of the max pool size), the caller thread is suspended waiting for a new thread to be available.

Parameters:
messageManager - the message manager that will be used for the new thread
Returns:
the AgletThread to use to manage messages.
Throws:
AgletException - if the specified message manager is null, or a problem occurs while waiting for a new thread to be available on the pool.

push

public void push(AgletThread thread)
          throws AgletException
Inserts (or re-inserts) a thread into the pool, making it available for other requests. Please note that if the pool already contains a reference to such thread or a number of threads greater than the maxPoolSize have been pushed, the pushing is aborted. An exception is thrown if it is forced to push a thread that does not belong to the thread group of the pooled threads.

Parameters:
thread - the thread to insert into the pool.
Throws:
if - the thread group is different from the one the pool has set at the thread creation.
AgletException
